DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgical removal of a kidney and its ureter.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of a kidney and its ureter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgical removal of a kidney and its ureter.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of a kidney and its ureter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgery to remove a kidney or part of a kidney. In a partial nephrectomy, part of one kidney or a tumor is removed, but not an entire kidney. In a simple nephrectomy, one kidney is removed. In a radical nephrectomy, an entire kidney, nearby adrenal gland and lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue are removed. In a bilateral nephrectomy, both kidneys are removed.

Concepts.definition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgery to remove a kidney or part of a kidney. In a partial nephrectomy, part of one kidney or a tumor is removed, but not an entire kidney. In a simple nephrectomy, one kidney is removed. In a radical nephrectomy, an entire kidney, nearby adrenal gland and lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue are removed. In a bilateral nephrectomy, both kidneys are removed.

Concepts.definition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or affecting only a part of something.: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgery to remove a kidney or part of a kidney. In a radical nephrectomy, an entire kidney, nearby adrenal gland and lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue are removed. In a bilateral nephrectomy, both kidneys are removed.

With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
